definitions.definition: a tune, especially the main tune in a piece of music written for several instruments or voices

examples.text: The melody is then taken up by the flutes.
Most of her songs have a bold melody.

definitions.definition: a piece of music or a song with a clear or simple tune
the arrangement of musical notes in a tune

examples.text: a few bars of melody drifted towards us

wordOrigin: Middle English (also in the sense ‘sweet music’): from Old French melodie, via late Latin from Greek melōidia, from melos ‘song’.
